required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of LY2951742 (Galcanezumab) in Participants With Cluster Headache
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3b Multicenter, Single-Arm, Open-Label Safety Study of LY2951742 (Galcanezumab) in Patients With Episodic or Chronic Cluster Headache

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to assess the long-term safety and tolerability of galcanezumab administered up to once monthly in participants with episodic or chronic cluster headache who have completed study I5Q-MC-CGAL (NCT02397473) or study I5Q-MC-CGAM (NCT02438826).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) or Serious AEs (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through End of Study (Approximately 4 Years)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Suicidal Ideation and Behaviors Collected by Columbia - Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through End of Study (Approximately 4 Years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Treatment Emergent Anti-Galcanezumab Antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through End of Study (Approximately 4 Years)

arm_group.description: Galcanezumab given subcutaneously (SQ) up to once a month.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants who participated in and completed either study CGAL or study CGAM.
- Investigator judges the participant as reliable to follow all study procedures, keep all study visits, and be compliant with study requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current enrollment in or discontinuation within the last 30 days from, a clinical trial involving any investigational drug or device (with the exception of Study CGAL or Study CGAM).
- Current use or any prior exposure to any calcitonin-gene-related peptide (CGRP) antibody, any antibody to the CGRP receptor, or antibody to nerve growth factor (NGF) (with the exception of Study CGAL or Study CGAM).
- A history of migraine variants that could implicate or could be confused with ischemia.
- Known hypersensitivity to multiple drugs, monoclonal antibodies or other therapeutic proteins.
- A history or presence of other medical illness that indicates a medical problem that would preclude study participation.
- Evidence of significant active or unstable psychiatric disease, in the opinion of the investigator.
- Women who are pregnant or nursing.

link.description: A Study of LY2951742 (Galcanezumab) in Participants With Cluster Headache

patient_data.ipd_description: Lilly provides access to the individual patient data from studies on approved medicines and indications as defined by the sponsor specific information on ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com This access is provided in a timely fashion after the primary publication is accepted. Researchers need to have an approved research proposal submitted through ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. Access to the data will be provided in a secure data sharing environment after signing a data sharing agreement.
